text: CCSS.Math.Content.HSA.APR.D.6 Rewrite simple rational expressions in different forms; write b ( x ) in the form q ( x ) + b ( x ) , where a ( x ), b ( x ), q ( x ), and r ( x ) are polynomials with the degree of r ( x ) less than the degree of b ( x ), using inspection, long division, or, for the more complicated examples, a computer algebra system.
